alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 7:20PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Berks, southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bucks and south central Northampton Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 720 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Topton, or 13 miles southwest of Allentown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Quakertown, Hellertown, Kutztown, East Greenville, Topton, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons, Pleasant Valley, Zionsville, Ancient Oaks, Lehigh University, Geryville, Fountain Hill, Pennsburg, Macungie and Freemansburg. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 42 and 57. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 50 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Berks; Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
